org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.datechooser
Class AbstractCombo

java.lang.Object
  Composite
      org.eclipse.nebula.widgets.datechooser.AbstractCombo
Direct Known Subclasses:
DateChooserCombo
public abstract class AbstractCombo
extends Composite

Abstract class for combo widgets composed of a Text, a Button and a popup associated to the button.

The creation of text, button and popup content is delegated to abstract methods.

Note that although this class is a subclass of Composite, it does not make sense to add children to it, or set a layout on it.

Styles:
BORDER, READ_ONLY, FLAT
Events:
Selection

public AbstractCombo(Composite parent,

Parameters:

style - the style of widget to construct
Method Detail

addModifyListener

public void addModifyListener(ModifyListener lsnr)
Adds the listener to the collection of listeners who will be notified when the receiver's text is modified, by sending it one of the messages defined in the ModifyListener interface.

Parameters:
lsnr - the listener which should be notified
See Also:
ModifyListener, removeModifyListener(ModifyListener)

addSelectionListener

public void addSelectionListener(SelectionListener lsnr)
Adds the listener to the collection of listeners who will be notified when the receiver's selection changes, by sending it one of the messages defined in the SelectionListener interface.

widgetSelected is called when the combo's list selection changes. widgetDefaultSelected is typically called when ENTER is pressed the combo's text area.

Parameters:
lsnr - the listener which should be notified
See Also:
SelectionListener, removeSelectionListener(SelectionListener)

beforeDrop

protected void beforeDrop()
Called just before the popup is droppped. Override to execute actions before the apparition of the popup.

By default, do nothing.

buttonEvent

protected void buttonEvent(Event event)
Manages button events.

Parameters:
event - event

comboEvent

protected void comboEvent(Event event)
Manages global combo events.

Parameters:
event - event

contentEvent

protected void contentEvent(Event event)
Manages popup content events. SelectionEvent are notified to all registered SelectionListeners of the combo.

Parameters:
event - event

createButtonControl

protected void createButtonControl(int style)
Creates the arrow button widget. Override to change appearance or behaviour of the button.

Parameters:
style - button style

createPopupContent

protected abstract void createPopupContent()
Creates the popup content. The popup is dependent of each implementation. Content can be a List, a Table or every other control.
The popupContent attribute must be setted with the created control. The parent must be the shell attribute, that is initialized by default with a FillLayout.

createTextControl

protected void createTextControl(int style)
Creates the text widget. Override to change appearance or behaviour of the text.

Parameters:
style - text style

dispose

public void dispose()
Disposes of the operating system resources associated with the receiver and all its descendents.

See Also:
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget#dispose()

dropDown

protected void dropDown(boolean drop)
Manages drop down of the popup.

Parameters:
drop - true to drop the popup, false to close

getEditable

public boolean getEditable()
Gets the editable state.

Returns:
whether or not the reciever is editable

getSelection

public Point getSelection()
Returns a Point whose x coordinate is the start of the selection in the receiver's text field, and whose y coordinate is the end of the selection. The returned values are zero-relative. An "empty" selection as indicated by the the x and y coordinates having the same value.

Returns:
a point representing the selection start and end

public int getStyle()
Returns the receiver's style information.

See Also:
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget#getStyle()

Returns:
the receiver's text

setLayout

public void setLayout(Layout layout)
Sets the layout which is associated with the receiver to be the argument which may be null.

Note : No Layout can be set on this Control because it already manages the size and position of its children.

Parameters:
layout - the receiver's new layout or null
